newsitem.title: SPAIN: Madrid stocks end lower on profit-taking.
newsitem.headline: Madrid stocks end lower on profit-taking.

text.p: Madrid stocks erased early gains to end mildly lower on Tuesday in a bout of profit-taking inspired by Monday's strong rally, dealers said.
* General index closes down 1.64 points, 0.31 percent, at 524.21
* Ibex-35 blue chip index down 16.78 points, 0.28 percent, to 6043.15
* Dealers see further gains near term from heavy domestic fund flows and positive tone on world markets but caution of pullback once euphoria fades
Dealers were expecting a pullback to around the 6,000 level on the Ibex and to 520 on the general index near-term but saw further gains fuelled by domestic fund flows and world markets.
"I think it is very clear the market is overbought and as soon as the euphoria calms down we will be looking for it to come back down," said Banco Santander dealer Nick Henderson.
Volume was heavy with 124 billion pesetas changing hands.
Banesto was one of the top performers with a gain of 4.24 percent. Argentaria was up 1.2 percent. Telefonica fell 10 pesetas to 3,815, Endesa was down 1.77 percent and Iberdrola rose 1.9 percent.
